Summarization: i was driving from cheadle hulme to manchester when i had to stop in traffic. out of nowhere, another car hit me from behind, which pushed my car into the one in front. i could feel pain in my neck and back almost right away. i had trouble sleeping and had to take painkillers regularly. it started improving after ten sessions of physiotherapy to help with the stiffness and discomfort. i don’t feel nervous driving, and i haven ’t had any emotional issues from the accident. i had to take a week off work, but after that, i was back to my usual routine. your muscles and spine seem to be in good condition. there are no signs of long - term damage or degeneration.

Sentiment_Intent_Analysis.text: >  *Good morning, doctor. I’m doing better, but I still have some discomfort now and then.*

>  *Yes, it was on September 1st, around 12:30 in the afternoon. I was driving from Cheadle Hulme to Manchester when I had to stop in traffic. Out of nowhere, another car hit me from behind, which pushed my car into the one in front.*
>  *At first, I was just shocked. But then I realized I had hit my head on the steering wheel, and I could feel pain in my neck and back almost right away.*
>  *Yes, I went to Moss Bank Accident and Emergency. They checked me over and said it was a whiplash injury, but they didn’t do any X-rays. They just gave me some advice and sent me home.*

>  *The first four weeks were rough. My neck and back pain were really bad—I had trouble sleeping and had to take painkillers regularly. It started improving after that, but I had to go through ten sessions of physiotherapy to help with the stiffness and discomfort.*
>  *It’s not constant, but I do get occasional backaches. It’s nothing like before, though.*
>  *No, nothing like that. I don’t feel nervous driving, and I haven’t had any emotional issues from the accident.*
>  *I had to take a week off work, but after that, I was back to my usual routine. It hasn’t really stopped me from doing anything.*
>  *That’s great to hear. So, I don’t need to worry about this affecting me in the future?*

Subjective.History_of_Present_Illness: i was driving from cheadle hulme to manchester when i had to stop in traffic. out of nowhere, another car hit me from behind, which pushed my car into the one in front. i could feel pain in my neck and back almost right away. i had trouble sleeping and had to take painkillers regularly. it started improving after ten sessions of physiotherapy to help with the stiffness and discomfort. i don’t feel nervous driving, and i haven ’t had any emotional issues from the accident. i had to take a week off work, but after that, i was back to my usual routine. your muscles and spine seem to be in good condition. there are no signs of long - term damage or degeneration.

Objective.Physical_Exam: Full range of motion in cervical and lumbar spine, no tenderness.
Objective.Observations: Patient appears in normal health, normal gait.

Plan.Follow-Up: Patient to return if pain worsens or persists beyond six months.
